products.name: Annaprashan Puja
products.description: Annaprashan is the ceremony where the baby is introduced to solid foods preferably Sweet/Milk Rice for the first time. The puja is performed to bestow a very healthy and prosperous life for the baby.

Insights:.text: Baby takes solid food for the first time.
It helps the baby to grow healthy and strong.
Performed on 6th or 7th month on Janma Nakshatra day.
Mantras are chanted for the baby’s well-being.
Kheer or Milk Rice is the main ingredient for the ceremony.

It is performed for the well-being of the baby and its family members especially Mother, Father, and Mamaji.

Performed to remove negative effects of Nakshatras.

products.name: Namkaran Puja
products.description: Namkaran Puja is the naming ceremony of a newborn baby. Namkaran Puja is a ritual of providing Samskaras to the child, which is considered of utmost importance in shaping the character and upbringing of a child.

products.name: Rudrabhishek Puja

This puja helps in having a strong mind, good health, and getting rid of evil effects. Performing this puja is to eliminate and overcome any obstacles that a person might come across in life. Lord Ram did Rudrabhishek in Rameshwaram to invoke Lord Shiva’s blessings before going to war with Ravan.

products.name: Satyanarayan Puja
products.description: Satyanarayan Puja is performed to appease Lord Satyanarayan, the most compassionate form of Lord Vishnu. Satya means Truth; Narayana means The highest being. Hence Lord Satyanarayan is considered the epitome of Truth and Justice. The puja is done to offer gratitude to the almighty on the start or successful completion of auspicious events in a person’s life. The puja is also performed to fulfill people’s wishes and desires. The purpose of this puja is to bring friends and family together, encourage unity and harmony to make sure that abundance, prosperity, general happiness, and well-being prevail in the family.

Insights:.text: Main Deity: Satyanarayan Bhagwan.

products.name: Vastu Shanti Puja

A home that is Vastu compliant will radiate Positive energy, reduces the malefic effects of bad Vastu, and help maintain the peace, harmony, and prosperity of the people staying in the home. Lord Vishwakarma is worshipped by engineers, architects, craftsmen, factory workers, and people in all professions as a mark of reverence to ensure a harmonious and prosperous career.

products.name: Vivah (Marriage)
products.description: Marriage Puja or Wedding Ceremony is one of the most important events in people’s life. It signifies the transitional state from Brahmacharayashram to Grihasthashramam. Performing Vivah puja acts as an invitation to the many Gods and Goddesses by performing various rituals to come and bless the couple. Vivah is a very sacred union. Performing Pooja for Marriage Ceremony acts as an invitation to the many Gods and Goddesses by performing various rituals to come and bless the couple. The Fire acts as the witness or Sakshi to this holy union. The promises made during Vivah Puja are lifelong commitments that the bride and the groom make to each other.

Insights:.text: It's a spiritual blessing and bond between couples.
It strengthens the relationship between the two families.
The date is fixed based on the auspicious alignments of the couple’s horoscope.

products.name: Yagnopavit Sanskar
products.description: Yagnopavit Sanskar or Upnayan Sanskar is performed to a boy who enters the age of 8. It makes a person fit to receive instruction in the Vedas and spread divine power throughout the world. Panditji begins this puja with Gauri Ganesh puja, Punyaha Vachan, Maha Sankalpam, Kalash puja, Upnayan. The havan is performed as per the Shastras. A Brahmin is also called a Dwija that means the one who is born twice. A boy is said to be born again when you perform Janeu Sanskar. A sacred thread, called Janeu or Yajnopaveetam is placed around the left shoulder of the boy.

Insights:.text: The boy attains the right to study Vedas through this sanskar.
This allows a Brahman boy to enter into Brahmacharya Avastha.
The three threads stand for Brahma, Vishnu, and Siva.
Done on an auspicious date compatible with Nakshatra of the boy.

Promise.text: All rituals follow Vedic Standards and Procedures.

products.name: Ayush Havan
products.description: Ayush havan creates positive vibrations and shields you against diseases and other health disorders. Lord Ayurdevata, an incarnation of Lord Vishnu is the chief deity of the havan who is the divine physician for all the three worlds. During Havan, Gauri Ganesh Kalash Nava Graha puja is performed and Ayush Suktam mantras are recited by the priest and the Havan is performed.

Insights:.text: Deity Worshiped is Lord Ayurdevata.

products.name: Gayatri Havan
products.description:
Gayatri Mata is considered the mother of all four Vedas. Performing this Jaap brings the blessings of the Sun, eradicates the sins of past life, helps to get rid of pitru dosh, enlightens and enables a person to possess divine qualities and success in life. Gayatri Jaap is performed by panditji, starting with Gauri Ganesh puja, Kalash Navgraha Puja, and the Jaap is chanted. In the end, a havan is performed.
॥ॐ भूर्भुवः स्वः तत्सवितुर्वरेण्यम् भर्गो देवस्य धीमहि धियो यो नः प्रचोदयात् ॥
